intro: Ionactis caelestis, commonly known as the celestial blue daisy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its bright blue petals and yellow center, which are typical of the genus Ionactis. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for xeriscaping and native gardens.
